result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheyenne R. Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. The costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning September 1, 2022.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cheyenne R. Cloud

records.addlTxt: Letters/correspondence to DE RE: bond forfeiture and payment plan
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

1:37 PM Defendant Cheyenne R. Cloud in court, in custody.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica J Prado appeared by video for Cheyenne R. Cloud. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Plea of guilty to count 1 - Possession of THC. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 - possession of THC.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Statement by Attorney Prado.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; $100.00 service of process fees; 4 days county jail with huber and good time with 4 days of sentence credit.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning September 1,2022.

Attorney Tlusty requests $200.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Court so orders $200.00 cash bond and for Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.-JN

Attorney Prado made a statement about contacting the defendant. Attorney Tlusty requests a body only bench warrant. Clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings. Court so orders.-JN

records.addlTxt: *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

01:11 PM Defendant Cheyenne R. Cloud in court by audio and video through Zoom with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  District attorney requests a signature bond in the amount of $500.00; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; booking.   Court sets bond as requested.   Defendant has until May 3, 2022 at 4:30 pm to sign her bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm. - rt
